title: Bug 102516 - JDBC Data Set Editor does not load tables and columns on demand
description: Bug 102516 - JDBC Data Set Editor should load tables and columns on demand. The JDBC Data Set Editor page for a SQL Query currently displays a tree control that lists all the tables and columns in the data source. On the iSeries platform using the JTOpenJDBC drivers, this tree control shows every schema (aka catalog) on the system, which can be several hundred tables. Currently, even with the schema filter, the tree is being populated on page load, causing a warning message to appear. The user wants the load of the tree to be deferred until the user expands the tree or applies a filter.
OB: On the iSeries platform using the JTOpenJDBC drivers, the JDBC Data Set Editor page displays a tree control that lists every schema (catalog) on the system, which includes several hundred tables. When loading the page, a warning message appears.
EB: The load of the tree in the JDBC Data Set Editor should be deferred until the user expands the tree or applies a filter. This way, the warning message will no longer appear during page load.
